oai_dc:dc.dc:title: ANTIREFLECTIVE VERTICAL STRUCTURE EXTENDED FOR ATTENUATION OF LOW FREQUENCY WAVES
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Gonzalez-Escriva, Jose Alberto
MEDINA, Josep Ramon
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: vertical structure
antireflective
low frequency waves
multiple unit wave chambers
cell circuits
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new maritime vertical structure was designed to improve the antireflective performance for wave reflection of wind waves and oscillations associated with intense storms, resonance waves in port basins, etc. Multiple unit chambers formed with long cell circuits (Medina et al., 2010) are responsible for the low frequency wave absorption that was studied through large-scale model testing.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 33 (2012): Proceedings of 33rd Conference on Coastal Engineering, Santander, Spain, 2012; structures.49
